content:
So have you contacted Telstra and asked them why they have blacklisted you sends mail using the IP 115.66.203.112.


But then that address is not a valid IP address. is has 5 blocks. 

115.66.203.112.80  a valid IPV4 address should have 4 blocks and an IP V6 address has eight groups of four hexadecimal digits. Each group is separated from the others by colons (:)  so i is not valid for that either.

So Are you using a VPN that is doing such a good job of hiding your IP address that is is not even using a valid one. Looking at the address a check of the first four blocks and the belongs to a router in Singapore owned by a company called Singnet Solutions Pte Ltd

The last four blocks belong t a company called Lattitude the IP address appears to be in Sydney, but the company is in Brazil.

So are you getting these error when you are connected using a VPN? Or perhaps a free Wifi at a pub or club or a coffee shop.

How are you connecting to the internet?

content:
Firewall - must have Thunderbird as an allowed program.

Check cookies are enabled: Settings > Privacy & Security Web content: Select 'Accept cookies from sites' Accept third-party cookies 'always'

outlook server and ( microsoft 365 outlook server) - Good and msn mail address ( set as standard) - ?

You may find the msn account is using the outlook server and that has recently changed to the use: - incoming: outlook.office365.com, port 993, SSL/TLS, Oauth2 (assuming IMAP) - outgoing: smtp.office365.com, port 587, STARTTLS, Oauth2


When you created msn and outlook accounts you should get a pop up prompt from outlook asking for relevant password of the account and then you get asked to 'Accept' to allow Thunderbird access to server. But that process uses 'localhost'.

As you have a website then maybe you use a program like 'Apache' 'Xampp' or similar and it uses 'localhost' You need to switch off - exit any of those programs whilst settings up those mail accounts.

When creating new mail account for email address for www.country-musicworld.eu. New > Existing mail account Enter Name, Email address and Password. If you click on 'Continue' Thunderbird will try to get settings - but it will fail to use correct settings as it is not a common server setting.

Click on 'Manage Configuration' Select 'Imap' or 'Pop as required. Then carefull check everything is entered correctly. User name = full email address Password - same as used to access webmail account.

content:
Probabilmente hai sbagliato nell'aggiungere un contatto alla rubrica:

La PEC nel sistema italiano è una particolare email con valore legale. Per ottenere questo risultato la comunicazione tra un mittente MITT ed un destinatario DEST è mediata dal una società abilitata alla gestione della PEC rispondente a precisi requisiti tecnici [1] (GEST). Nelle intestazioni della PEC avremi quindi riferimenti a MITT, DEST e GEST. Supponiamo che DEST, ricevuta una PEC da MITT, voglia aggiungere il mittente alla propria rubrica di Thunderbird. A volte capita che al nome di MITT non vanga associato il relativo indirizzo email ma quello dell'intermediario GEST. Il risultato è che da quel momento in poi tutte le PEC ricevute da utenti di GEST appariranno con mittente MIT, talvolta con la dicitura "per conto di". Per risolvere il problema è necessario cancellare il contatto MITT dalla rubrica. 1. è una semplificazione funzionale al discorso

content:
Some options:

- copy the profile into the c:\users\<yourid>\appata\roaming\thunderbird\profiles - then, click help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll down to 'proflies' and click 'about:profiles' - now, click 'create profile' button, then click 'next - now, enter short name for profile, such as OLDPROFILE, and then click the 'choose' button to locate and activate the profile you copied in. and then launch it.

If the profile is incomplete or corrupt, you can still copy components with thunderbird not running, using windows file explorer to copy message files to the Mail\Local Folders folder.

content: I went into File > Page Setup and set the top margin there, as I've done thousands of times before. I don't know what keystrokes I did -- as I've said, it was a slip of the fingers and must have been more than 300 because there was no space left at the bottom of the page. You are probably in USA, so I should have explained that 300 means 300 millimetres, the metric measurement we use here in Australia (and in most of the world).

content:
click on the 'View' option to see the details, so you can check it out.

Click on 'Confirm security exception' - it gets added.

Certificates are visible in this place

  • Settings > Privacy & Security
  • Scroll to 'Security' section
  • click on 'Manage Certificates'


It's possible your Anti-Virus is causing the pop up. eg: deactivate Avast mail shield / stop scanning mail

content:
Current Situation: Settings > General scroll to 'Incoming Mails'

You can choose: 'Uncheck 'Show an alert' - to switch off pop up notifications.

'Select 'Show an alert' - to use Thunderbird pop up And if you want to use the system notification : select 'Use the system notification'

If you switch the alerts off then you could just use the sound. Select 'Play a sound' Choose prefered sound.

If you do have alerts enabled and choose to use the system notification. You could try this: Click on 'Customise' Show new mail alert for: reduce to 1 second and click on 'OK'

Then you will get a pop up but it will disappear fast. So not much of a distraction. But if you want to check what arrived then you can click on the 'Notifications' icon - bottom right of Task bar tray area to see the list of notifications.

There is no option in Thunderbird to detect whether Thunderbird window has focus before posting the pop up alert.
creator: Toad-Hall

content: Additionally, attempting to install version 128.3.0esr, the "latest stable," now results in a warning that my profile is no longer compatible. How am I supposed to untangle this mess?
creator: James6M

content: click to settings>general and scroll down to the updates area and click 'show update history.' My guess is you were using version 125.0 or 130.0, neither of which are accessible from thunderbird.net for download. There are some software distributors, such as Majorgeeks, that offer unsupported versions. My guess is that you got the prior version from such a place. If the default updates did this, there would be tens of thousands of users experiencing it. My suggestion is to install the latest release and, if you receive any compatibility messages, to look for and delete a file called compatibilities.ini
creator: davidsk
